title: Plastic Tooling Process Engineer
summary:
Imagine what you could do here. At Apple, creative ideas have a way of becoming wonderful products, services, and customer experiences very quickly. Bring passion and dedication to your job and there's no telling what you could accomplish.

The people here at Apple don’t just create products — they create the kind of wonder that’s revolutionized entire industries. description:
-  Manage molding trials for new programs, providing feedback for corrective actions to tooling engineering, molding and material suppliers.

-  Establish necessary process parameters for a given part to meet all Apple functional and cosmetic requirements.

-  Act as first level engineering response to production quality issues for molded plastic parts.

-  Determine root cause, and where appropriate, institute corrective actions.

-  Collaborate with supply management, product design and quality engineering groups on material selection, design feasibility, aesthetics and production process control of new part designs.

-  Participate in supplier factory audits and assessments to define their capabilities and suitability for molding Apple products.

-  Take the leading role in suggesting or adopting ideas for improving productivity and quality of part manufacturing, molding and tooling techniques.

-  Train supplier engineers at plastic manufacturing plants in Asia to apply new materials and processing techniques.

-  Develop collaborative relationships with Apple suppliers through training and quality control visits.

-  Will be an advisor to plants and cross functional team members on maintaining correct controls on the processes and inspection certificates on the materials.
key_qualifications:
Minimum 8 years plastic processing (injection molding preferred) experience in molding and / or plastic materials industry.
Excellent knowledge of plastic materials and design for manufacturing in terms of geometry and cosmetic quality.
Experience debugging complex tools and processes.
Experience processing a wide variety of materials.
Experience in handling multiple tool development programs with regional and overseas vendors is preferred.
Mold Flow analysis capabilities are a plus.
Be able to work independently or within a team.
Able to travel up to 25% of the time.
Able to communicate (verbal and written) technical information in English. Knowledge of fluency in Mandarin is a plus.
education_experience: BS or MS Plastics Engineer preferred (Plastics Engineering; ME, Chem E)
